May 28, 2020

  • Opinion Link: https://www.nydailynews.com/opinion/#nt=taxonomy-article

Bob Eckstein’s coronavirus cartoonery Link: /opinion/ny-bob-eckstein-coronavirus-cartoon-20200408-vcfun5yq55fybn3q6rhgn2x44q-photogallery.html

Bob Eckstein, a cartoonist, author of “The Illustrated History of the Snowman” and “Footnotes from the World’s Greatest Bookstores,” takes on the coronavirus pandemic with editorial cartoons.

The protests and riots this week concerning the deaths of George Floyd and Breonna Taylor at the hands of law enforcement in Minneapolis and Louisville have dominated the current news cycle, reigniting scrutiny on how the police in this country interact with African-Americans. While these events may appear to some as one-off reactions to isolated incidences, the phenomenon of police violence is, sadly, an issue that has plagued the legal system for quite some time.
